div.p:
To proof.
MRS 4 is called: Copies of correspondence sent: first series 23 September 1882-14 July 1921, do we need to include that?.
4th May [188]7
editorial addition.

The Committee of Management has, this day appointed you collector of New South Wales timbers for this Museum. Each specimen will be in the log, and from 3' 6" to 4' long. This work will occupy nearly the whole (if not the whole) of your time.
I write to you in a day or two giving you full instructions.

The Committee in conjunction with Baron Mueller, have decided to send you to the far north west of this colony to collect economic vegetable products and botanical specimens. You are prepared to accept this appointment, I learn from Baron Mueller,
x-ref.
and you will receive from the Baron and me full instructions in due course.

I expect you will be requested to start on your trip to the north west the first week in August at latest. Meantime all your available time will be fully occupied in collecting timbers in addition to the other specimens you now collect.
